@tobajas I think he's closer around the age range you posted for him. And it hadn't even been 5 years since they met as the show they both were on had been on the air for 4 years while they've only known each other for 3. Dude jumped the gun after 3 years because he got desperate and they weren't even dating while he was expecting her to marry him, lol. 'Course, now he's gonna be losing his cushy TV job and probably become someone's plaything in prison, but hey, he got to rape her once, I guess.

One of the most satisfying sleeping doujin to date IMO. I didn't really think he needed to flat out expose himself along with her since he'd already gotten away with a satisfying journey of revenge already, but I guess the big reveal during her wedding makes the whole thing feel more dramatic and grand for us reading it.

@tobajas He feels more desperate/delusional than narcissistic. The convo he flashes back to on page 10 shows he took her "5 years" thing seriously, but he got desperate at tried to propose after 3.

I can't say I would do what the guy did. But I sure as hell applaud for the savagery. It's worrisome, but hilarious.
Revenge is sure is cruel and somewhat sweet. But that woman deserve it.

Well while I might be wrong on this my guess is the woman is somewhere around 25-30 but most likely around 25ish, since in Japan in a lot of cases women are expected to be engaged/married around 20-25 and if they around 27-28+ it's almost seen as if no one wants them if not. The guy on the other hand seems in my eyes to be around 40-50ish but he could be younger, but looking at his face and receding hairline (which is normally used/seen on characters who are close to 50 or older) I am pretty sure he's 40-50+. With her also saying he's more close to a dad the age gap should be signifigant at least 10 years but probably 20+. So that he would expect her to marry him just cause they work together out of the blue is quite narcissistic (which I think the author is trying to showcase here). But yeah with the ending he should go to jail 100%.

The fact that people like an ending where the rapist got to "disgrace" (why is disgraceful for the woman to be raped i will never understand) the woman in her wedding just because she rejected him, is very fucking worrisome.

Guy is basically admitting to raping her, so I guess he's fine with getting locked up. That he took getting rejected by someone who looks way younger than he is *this* bad is pretty worrying when it doesn't seem like they spent a whole lot of time together off-camera.
